alert.note: Alert for Iron (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 3:14PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR KANARRA CREEK IN SOUTHEASTERN IRON COUNTY... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. With existing elevated stream flows, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kanarra Creek, Kanarra Falls, Kanarraville... As much as 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen in the area over the previous hour. Light showers may continue but little additional in the way of measurable precipitation is expected. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
